subject: RE: [junit] How to write Test Cases for Jsp's
msgSnippet: I d say you have two choices.  Choice one would be to get your java code out of any scriptlets and into classes (and if you have more than 50 lines of java in
messageBody:
I'd say you have two choices. Choice one would be to get your java code out
of any scriptlets and into classes (and if you have more than 50 lines of
java in your jsp's I'd say its a good idea anyway) and test the classes the
way you would normally do. If you really don't want to do this, I believe
your only other choice is to look into HttpUnit. HttpUnit allows you to
work with the html output of your jsp using getXXX methods (like getTitle()
to work with the <TITLE> tag info, etc.) and also lets you work with the
html page DOM model. Working with the DOM model would likely be a bit
brittle, in that any change to the nesting in your html would probably mess
you up. There is also an apache project called "Cactus" that you could use
if you want to test your jsp as a servlet, but I don't know much about that
option yet. Hope this helps.

Frank

> 4) Can any body explain the procedure
> regards Bhanu
